minimum.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed
minimum.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The minimum number of students we need to run the course is fifteen.
The minimum age for retirement is 55.
minimum.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary
minimum.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The judge recommended that he should serve a minimum of 12 years.
a minimum of two hours/£1,000 etc
Prison inmates are kept in tiny cells, with the bare minimum of furniture.
She had reduced her consumption of fat and sugar to an absolute minimum.
He achieved enviable results with the minimum of effort.
minimum.translation[1].note_box[0].secti: Candidates should have a minimum of five years’ work experience.
Keep the noise to a minimum, will you?
We want to reduce the environmental impact to a minimum.
We’ll need a minimum of two days to get this ready.
He paid in five pounds, the bare minimum needed to keep the bank account open.
The wage was often well below the legal minimum.
He received 35 votes, two more than the required minimum.
They checked our passports with the minimum of fuss.
The house could be restored with a minimum of effort.
minimum.translation[2].definitions[0].de: the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed
minimum.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Minimum investment in each fund is £2000.
There is a minimum charge of £30.
The minimum requirements for the job are a degree and a teaching qualification.
minimum.translation[3].definitions[0].de: the smallest amount or number of something that is possible, allowed, or needed
minimum.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Applicants should have a minimum of five years’ professional experience.
The company needed to raise a minimum of £150 million in new equity.
minimum.translation[3].definitions[1].de: to limit something to the smallest amount or degree possible
minimum.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: It is essential that we keep costs to a minimum.
Risks must be reduced to the absolute minimum.
